intro: Cyclostemon mindorensis, commonly known as the Mindanao cyclostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments and is often found in humid, shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
